org.wonderly.jini2
Class PersistentJiniService

java.lang.Object
  org.wonderly.jini2.NameableObjectImpl
      org.wonderly.jini2.ConfigurableJiniApplication
          org.wonderly.jini2.PersistentJiniService
All Implemented Interfaces:
Remote, ServiceIDAccessor, NameableObject, AppPersistenceIO
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConfigProviderTest, ConfigurationManager, HttpServerService, JiniExplorerDemo, JiniExplorerImpl, MultiServiceAppDemo, PropertiesUIDemo, SimpleService
public class PersistentJiniService
extends ConfigurableJiniApplication
implements AppPersistenceIO, ServiceIDAccessor, Remote

This class provides a base class for creating persistant Jini services under the Jini 2.0 specifications. It provides for the use of a Configuration. The configuration source is the class name by default via the getPackage() and the getName() methods.

The ConfigurableJiniApplication subclass has a great deal of functionality in the form of convienence classes to process configuration and logging setup. Please consult that documentation for more specifics.

This class creates an instance of the JiniAdmin class that needs to have a configuration entry specified in the configuration file under the class name of JiniAdmin. In particular, this JiniAdmin instance is the registered object that implements the JiniAdmins interface's super interfaces. Thus, the correct exporter for that interface and any associated contraints needs to specified in that configuration. 

        org.wonderly.util.jini2.JiniAdmin {
                exporter = ...
                locators = ...
                preparer = ...
                entries = ...
        }

Author:
Gregg Wonderly.

Description copied from interface: AppPersistenceIO
A check to see if writes should occur. Typically if a read exception occurs, this would throw an IOException from that point on to keep writes from occuring.

getExportedObject

public Object getExportedObject()
                         throws IOException,
                                ConfigurationException
This method is a convenience method for the use of subclasses. It provides a simple way to get the service object corresponding to using the configured Exporter on this. If your services object is not derived from exporting this, you should override this method to return the correct object for your use, and the use of any subclass of your class that might not know how to derive the object.

Throws:
IOException
ConfigurationException

getAdmin

public Object getAdmin()
                throws RemoteException
Get the JiniAdmin instance that we are using to manage the administration of this instance. If you want remote access to the JiniAdmin stub, you should create a subclass of this which implements an interface (Administrable) that has getAdmin() in it. Then, you can getAdmin() to get the reference.

Throws:
RemoteException
See Also:
JiniAdmin

startService

public void startService(String name,
                         String serFile)
                  throws IOException,
                         ConfigurationException
Start the service registration process using the passed data. If the configuration entry, "loginContext" is set to an instance of LoginContext, then a JAAS login will be executed prior to starting the service, and the associated login Subject will be used in a Subject.doAsPrivileged(Subject,java.security.PrivilegedExceptionAction,java.security.AccessControlContext) call.

Parameters:
name - the default initial name for the service.
serFile - the file to store the serialized data for service config into.
Throws:
IOException
ConfigurationException

addNameIfMissing

public boolean addNameIfMissing()
If returns true, a Name entry will be added to the defaults using the name passed to startService, if none is provided otherwise.

startService

public static PersistentJiniService.JoinContext startService(String name,
                                                             String serFile,
                                                             Object exported,
                                                             boolean addName,
                                                             ConfigurableJiniApplication app,
                                                             AppPersistenceIO appio)
                                                      throws IOException,
                                                             ConfigurationException
Start the service registration process using the passed data.

Parameters:
name - the default initial name for the service.
serFile - the file to store the serialized data
exported - the exported or otherwise service object
addName - true to add Name Entry to Attributes
app - the ConfigurableJiniApplication instance to use
appio - the AppPersistenceIO instance to use for persistence.
Throws:
IOException
ConfigurationException
See Also:
startService(String, String, Object, boolean, Configuration, String, AppPersistenceIO)

startService

public static PersistentJiniService.JoinContext startService(String name,
                                                             String serFile,
                                                             Object exported,
                                                             boolean addName,
                                                             Configuration conf,
                                                             String component,
                                                             AppPersistenceIO appio)
                                                      throws IOException,
                                                             ConfigurationException
Start the service registration process using the passed data. This method will construct a new ConfigurableJiniApplication instance to use for Configuration access. It will then defer to startService(String, String, Object, boolean, ConfigurableJiniApplication, AppPersistenceIO) to continue starting the service

Parameters:
name - the default initial name for the service.
serFile - the file to store the serialized data for service config into.
exported - the exported, or serializable service object.
addName - true to add "name" as a net.jini.core.lookup.Name() value
conf - a configuration to use
component - the configuration component's entry value to use
appio - an implementation of appio for persistence
Throws:
IOException
ConfigurationException
